Author: jansako#3330
Content:
Correct me if I am wrong, but currently there is no way of seeing the order book for a coin that the user already does to have a balance in their wallet.
In a way it is logical, but I would want to know the price before I send any to my DEX wallet... 

In other words, this is a feature request: Show order books for coins with 0 balance.

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: this is a dumb question but all the swaps on this public beta are real swaps right? not a testnet

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
rick - morty pair are the test coins
the rest of the pairs are real trades between real coins involving their blockchains

Author: ca333#0118
Content: even Rick and Morty trades are **real** swaps - this is a production/live DEX network. No testnet. However, still considered beta-stage.

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: how many years this been in development?

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: before this there was public beta signup - how long was that going on for?

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: thx for any replies

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a document with detailed timeline, basically started around 2014, so 5+ years

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @gigamesh - Komodo's DEX technology has been in development for half a decade like stated above -  AtomicDEX is our 3rd generation DEX technology which was eventually ported from the legacy codebase and tech-stack to the new protocol and state of the art tech-stack. The closed beta was going on for around 2 months before reaching public beta stage.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: https://komodoplatform.com/komodo-and-the-early-pioneers-of-atomic-swaps/

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i did 5 iterations to get to mm1

Author: ca333#0118
Content: https://www.binance.vision/blockchain/atomic-swaps-explained for instance is a good reference @gigamesh - it states jl777 as the father of automated cross chain atomic swap technology dated back in 2014

Author: ca333#0118
Content: this recent Forbes article highlights AtomicDEX too - https://www.forbes.com/sites/lukefitzpatrick/2019/09/02/a-complete-beginners-guide-to-atomic-swaps/#32102e876178
